column100:
For their Danish location in Nivå, CLAAS E-Systems is searching for a skilled and experienced Embedded Linux Software Engineer. 
   
 About the job: 
 As part of CLAAS E-Systems’ expanding development team in Nivå, you will contribute to development of innovative new functionality targeting automation and optimization of farming machinery. 
   
 You will play a key role in bridging the gap between software and hardware, enabling application developers to access and utilize platform features and devices optimally. Claas’ area of expertise lies within machine vision based on 2D/3D sensor technology and its application onto everyday farming challenges – from ideation to deployment of the final product at their partners and customers. 
   
 You will be interacting with technologies and frameworks such as C/C++/Python, Linux kernel/device drivers/applications, V4L2, GPU/NPU, Yocto, Git, etc. 
   
 Your responsibilities: 
 
 Development of software modules in C/C++ for Linux-based embedded devices and machine vision systems 
 Design and documentation of software architecture and interfaces 
 Configuration and maintenance of software builds using CMake, including integration of third-party libraries 
 Development and maintenance of Linux BSP using YOCTO for in-house embedded processing platform 
 Bridging the gaps between embedded hardware devices, device drivers and application software in a Linux environment 
 Development and maintenance of automated tests and test setups 
 Participation in field-tests of embedded systems, nationally as well as internationally 
 Consultation with internal stakeholders to determine the scope of and requirements to development projects 
 
   
 Your qualifications: 
 
 B.Sc., M.Sc. or similar degree in computer science 
 Strong proficiency in embedded Linux software development using C and C++ 
 Extensive hands-on experience with development and maintenance of software on embedded devices 
 Strong knowledge of and familiarity with Linux and relevant command line tools 
 Experience with embedded systems, real-time environments and low-level hardware interactions 
 Experience with automated testing platforms and unit tests 
 Experience with versioning control using Git and Git flows 
 Knowledge of optical sensor technologies such as camera, LIDAR or radar considered a plus 
 Fluent in spoken and written English 
 
   
 As a person you are: 
 
 Structured and with good sense of detail 
 Quality conscious 
 Innovative, curious and entrepreneurial 
 A team player, yet able to take on tasks on your own 
 Able to understand complex problems and system interactions 
 Not afraid to get your hands dirty 
 Excellent collaboration and communication skills 
 Comfortable with SCRUM as working principle 
 Residing in Denmark or Europe, has a valid work & resident permit and ready to relocate to Denmark 
 
   
 Since Claas’ headquarter is located in Dissen am Teutoburger Wald in Germany, you should expect limited travel activities from time to time. 
 About the CLAAS Group and CLAAS E-Systems 
 The CLAAS Group  is one of the world's leading manufacturers of agricultural technology. Its modern and innovative harvesting machines, tractors, balers and agricultural information technologies help to meet the ever-increasing demand for food, energy and raw materials. 
   
 CLAAS employs around 11,500 employees worldwide and reported a turnover of beyond € 4.0 billion in 2020. The company was founded by the CLAAS brothers in 1913 and is still – more than 100 years later – family-owned. 
   
 CLAAS E-Systems  is the integrated CLAAS Group partner for electronics and electrical systems. More than 250 employees develop innovative, intelligent software, sensor systems and machine components to increase efficiency in agriculture through automation and optimization. Claas’ Danish department in Nivå specializes in machine vision and has more than 20 years of experience in this field. 
   
 For additional information, please visit  http://www.claas-e-systems.com . 
 Interested? 
 The recruitment process is handled by mpeople on behalf of Claas. If you have any questions about the position or Claas, please get in touch with Birgitte Vilsgaard on bgv@mpeople.dk or  +45 28 18 18 91 . 
   
 We look forward to hearing from you. 
 #jobsforukraine
